Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments, including 1886,0401.1086) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery krater; interior reserved; exterior; cream slip; ridge at base of neck with zone of tongues below; broad dividing band between zone of tongues and main decorative field: part of sphinx and goose to left; filling ornaments: blobs and roughly drawn rosettes; red patches on head of sphinx, on neck and on alternate section of goose and on rosettes; incision used for part of the outline and for details of sphinx, goose and rosettes. Two drill holes for ceramic analysis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.516)
